Private Litigation Case Title: Birmingham Employees' Retirement System, City of et al v. Comerica Incorporated

Description: Comerica Bank agreed to pay $110,000 to the state and offer full buybacks  of their Auction Rate Securities in settlement of allegations their marketing misrepresented the suitability of ARS products.

The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority ordered 12 firms to pay restitution totaling more than $4 million and fines totaling more than $2.6 million for failing to apply available sales charge discounts to customers' purchases of Unit Investment Trusts (UITs), and related supervisory failures.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority reached agreements in principle with SunTrust Investment Services, Inc. and SunTrust Robinson Humphrey, Inc., both of Atlanta, GA, Comerica Securities, Inc. of Detroit, MI, First Southwest Company of Dallas, TX, and WaMu Investments, Inc., of Irvine, CA, to settle charges relating to the sale of Auction Rate Securities.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
